item.title: Tutorial part 5: Deploying to GitHub
item.description: The usual advice for deploying a blogdown site is to deploy to Netlify rather than GitHub Pages, because there are a few peculiarities with GitHub Pages that make this difficult. However, I have an ingrained habit of using GitHub Pages, with each repository hosted at https://username.github.io/reponame/ To make that happen for a blogdown site there are three things you need to change from the usual defaults: First, the site needs to be generated in the docs folder (which is what GitHub Pages expects) rather than the Hugo default which is to generate the site in the public folder.
